scenario_title: Miscellaneous Insider Espionage via Privilege Abuse

why.details: The insider leaked sensitive internal data to external competitors or entities in exchange for monetary gain and to influence strategic business dynamics in their favor.

how.description: Abused privileged internal access to query and collect classified and sensitive company files.
how.procedure: Insider with elevated privileges queries shared drives, document repositories and internal DBs to identify and gather classified company reports and employee lists before exfiltration preparation.
observable_evidence: Large file reads from secure directories by privileged account
Directory listing and file discovery activity in restricted folders
Access to internal database tables containing employee lists outside normal workflow
how.impact: Acquisition of high-value assets increases risk of strategic loss and competitive disadvantage for the organization.

how.description: Installed unauthorized software and used password-cracking / keylogging tools to obtain colleagues’ credentials, expanding access footprint.
how.procedure: Insider deploys tools (e.g., keyloggers, credential dumpers) or uses stolen/password-reused credentials to compromise additional accounts and escalate privileges across the network.
observable_evidence: Installation of keylogger or credential dumping tool on endpoint
Multiple login failures or credential reuse events on internal accounts
Use of compromised credentials to access systems previously inaccessible to the user
how.impact: Broader credential compromise facilitates lateral movement, persistent access and deeper infiltration into sensitive environments.

how.description: Copied sensitive documents to removable media and concealed them using file hiding/encryption techniques.
how.procedure: Insider uses elevated privileges to copy classified documents onto encrypted portable storage or hidden partitions, and may schedule transfer or hide data before external delivery.
observable_evidence: USB insertion events followed by large‐scale file copy operations
Creation of encrypted archive/ZIP file on system containing sensitive filenames
Transfer of hidden or encrypted files from internal system to external medium
how.impact: Physical exfiltration of classified data leads to information loss, regulatory compliance risk and damage to organizational reputation.

how.description: Browsed external competitor websites and job postings to initiate covert contact or evaluate value of stolen data.
how.procedure: Insider uses internal access to research external entities (competitors, recruiters) and prepare for data monetization or espionage, potentially contacting them covertly through hidden channels.
observable_evidence: Web traffic to competitor domains and job-posting sites from insider workstation
Use of anonymization tools or private browser sessions to connect externally
Email or chat communication with external entities discussing value or sale of data
how.impact: Pre-exfiltration preparation with external adversaries increases strategic threat and long-term risk.

how.description: Monitored internal communication systems to detect any investigation indicators referencing their own activity.
how.procedure: Insider monitors internal audit or security logs, uses tools to delete or alter entries that could link activity to them, and may use proxy execution or signed binaries to evade detection.
observable_evidence: Deletion or alteration of audit/security log entries shortly after high-privilege access events
Use of unsigned or rarely seen binaries executed via proxy mechanisms
Use of monitoring tools or scripts reading internal comms or logs unexpectedly
how.impact: Reduced detectability allows prolonged undetected activity, increasing cumulative damage and dwell time.
